pageContext.claim: “President Obama, President Clinton, President Bush, they've declared many national -- this is not unique -- they've declared many national emergencies. Many, many. And you have some out there that we can use in addition to one that we can declare if we want to do it.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is not the first president to declare a national emergency. But he is the first to declare one in an effort to get funding for something -- in this case, a border wall -- that Congress didn't approve. The constitution says Congress and the president must agree on how to spend tax dollars. The legality of Trump's move is being challenged in court and there's no certainty he will win.
